grahampaige.comment: Roll-call vote if possible, Graham. OK. Ms Carlson? No. Oh sorry, wrong button. Yeah. All those opposed, same sign. Motion carried. The time being approximately six minutes past seven o'clock p.m., having no further business, seeing none, moved by Vice Chair Carlson, seconded by Ms Del Carro, that we go into closed session whereupon motions duly adopted by unanimous consent of the Board by recorded vote. Is there anything else anyone would like to add prior to us entering executive session? Anything else? Then upon motion made by Ms Colston, seconded by Ms Johnston, vice chairperson page declared by law, this meeting adjourned unto closed season. By mutual agreement of the School Board and its chairman, vice-chairman, pursuant to Virginia Code Section 2351A, et seq., electronic participation is hereby authorized due to emergency circumstances announced by Governor Northam on March 12th declaring that the COVID pandemic constitutes disaster necessitating continuity plans effective immediately throughout affected areas within the Commonwealth of Virginia. This notice shall serve public bodies required by section two point three five zero eight A one giving them access electronically unless otherwise exempted below. Our clerk has determined that the number of people who can physically attend meetings safely may exceed capacity limits based on CDC social distancing guidelines given current health conditions. Therefore, she finds that conducting certain parts virtually ensures safety while maintaining transparency best practices open government obligations per subsection B four requiring certification by local chief administrative officers certifying virtual sessions' compliance using alternative means prescribed by statute including video conferencing technology.
